greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Inverse of number triangle A103451.
comment: Row sums are 0^n. Diagonal sums are 0^n - (1-(-1)^n)/2.

Triangle T(n,k), 0 <= k <= n, read by rows given by [ -1, 2, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, ...] DELTA [1, 0, -1/2, 1/2, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, ...] where DELTA is the operator defined in A084938. - _Philippe Deléham_, May 01 2007
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10010 (Rows 0 <= n <= 140)
formula: Number triangle T(n,k) = if(n=k, 1, if(n>0 and k=0, -1, 0)).
mathematica: Table[Range[n] /. {k_ /; k == 1 && n != 1 -> -1, k_ /; k == n -> 1, _Integer -> 0}, {n, 15}] // Flatten (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jul 21 2016 *)
results.author: _Paul Barry_, Feb 06 2005
